revised_title: Meteorology of the Lake District and Rainfall Experiments
tldr: The author presents meteorological observations and rainfall experiments conducted in the Lake District, focusing on a new station, 'the Sty,' on Sprinkling Fell. The Sty, located 580 feet above Seathwaite, is found to have a higher rainfall rate, with 189.49 inches of rain in 1850, compared to Seathwaite's 160.89 inches in the same year.
